page.title: 10BIRDS OF BEWCASTLE
page.content: As with the animal life, a fair variety lives in this area.They can be split into three groups , all year , summer visitors and winter visitors.Starting with the last one we have geese which come inland from the Solway,fieldfare,redwing,siskin and brambling.Summer visitors include house martins,swallows,cuckoos,swifts, lapwings, curlews, sandpipers, redshanks, skylarks, ring ouzels, wheatears, winchats, willow warblers, spotted flycatchers, wagtails and chiffchaffs.Among the resident birds are several birds of prey- kestrels, sparrowhawks, merlins, with occasional sitings of buzzards, peregrines and even golden eagles on the nearby fells.Crows and pigeons are often shot in the area as pest control, pheasants and ducks as sport.
